verses.text: Every man of Judah and Jerusalem returned with Jehoshaphat at their head, returning to Jerusalem with joy, for the Lord had made them to rejoice over their enemies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Jerusalem with harps, lyres and trumpets to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dread of God was on all the kingdoms of the lands when they heard that the Lord had fought against the enemies of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the kingdom of Jehoshaphat was at peace, for his God gave him rest on all sides.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah. He was thirty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem twenty-five years. And his mother’s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walked in the way of his father Asa and did not depart from it, doing right in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The high places, however, were not removed; the people had not yet directed their hearts to the God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first to last, behold, they are written in the annals of Jehu the son of Hanani, which is recorded in the Book of the Kings of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jehoshaphat king of Judah allied himself with Ahaziah king of Israel. He acted wickedly in so doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he allied himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish, and they made the ships in Ezion-geber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat saying, “Because you have allied yourself with Ahaziah, the Lord has destroyed your works.” So the ships were broken and could not go to Tarshish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers and was buried with his fathers in the city of David, and Jehoram his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had brothers, the sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, Jehiel, Zechariah, Azaryahu, Michael and Shephatiah. All these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their father gave them many gifts of silver, gold and precious things, with fortified cities in Judah, but he gave the kingdom to Jehoram because he was the firstborn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jehoram had taken over the kingdom of his father and made himself secure, he killed all his brothers with the sword, and some of the rulers of Israel also.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He walked in the way of the kings of Israel, just as the house of Ahab did (for Ahab’s daughter was his wife), and he did evil in the sight of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the Lord was not willing to destroy the house of David because of the covenant which He had made with David, and since He had promised to give a lamp to him and his sons forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his days Edom revolted against the rule of Judah and set up a king over themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoram crossed over with his commanders and all his chariots with him. And he arose by night and struck down the Edomites who were surrounding him and the commanders of the chariots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Edom revolted against Judah to this day. Then Libnah revolted at the same time against his rule, because he had forsaken the Lord God of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and caused the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the harlot and led Judah astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a letter came to him from Elijah the prophet saying, “Thus says the Lord God of your father David, ‘Because you have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat your father and the ways of Asa king of Judah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but have walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and have caused Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the harlot as the house of Ahab played the harlot, and you have also killed your brothers, your own family, who were better than you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: behold, the Lord is going to strike your people, your sons, your wives and all your possessions with a great calamity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will suffer severe sickness, a disease of your bowels, until your bowels come out because of the sickness, day by day.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines and the Arabs who bordered the Ethiopians;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they came against Judah and invaded it, and carried away all the possessions found in the king’s house together with his sons and his wives, so that no son was left to him except Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after all this the Lord smote him in his bowels with an incurable sickness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about in the course of time, at the end of two years, that his bowels came out because of his sickness and he died in great pain. And his people made no fire for him like the fire for his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was thirty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years; and he departed with no one’s regret, and they buried him in the city of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah, his youngest son, king in his place, for the band of men who came with the Arabs to the camp had slain all the older sons. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah began to reign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaziah was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned one year in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Athaliah, the granddaughter of Omri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, for his mother was his counselor to do wickedly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did evil in the sight of the Lord like the house of Ahab, for they were his counselors after the death of his father, to his destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also walked according to their counsel, and went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to wage war against Hazael king of Aram at Ramoth-gilead. But the Arameans wounded Joram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which they had inflicted on him at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Aram. And Ahaziah, the son of Jehoram king of Judah, went down to see Jehoram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the destruction of Ahaziah was from God, in that he went to Joram. For when he came, he went out with Jehoram against Jehu the son of Nimshi, whom the Lord had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about when Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, he found the princes of Judah and the sons of Ahaziah’s brothers ministering to Ahaziah, and slew them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also sought Ahaziah, and they caught him while he was hiding in Samaria; they brought him to Jehu, put him to death and buried him. For they said, “He is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought the Lord with all his heart.” So there was no one of the house of Ahaziah to retain the power of the kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she rose and destroyed all the royal offspring of the house of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jehoshabeath the king’s daughter took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him from among the king’s sons who were being put to death, and placed him and his nurse in the bedroom. So Jehoshabeath, the daughter of King Jehoram, the wife of Jehoiada the priest (for she was the sister of Ahaziah), hid him from Athaliah so that she would not put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was hidden with them in the house of God six years while Athaliah reigned over the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened himself, and took captains of hundreds: Azariah the son of Jeroham, Ishmael the son of Johanan, Azariah the son of Obed, Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri, and they entered into a covenant with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went throughout Judah and gathered the Levites from all the cities of Judah, and the heads of the fathers’ households of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the assembly made a covenant with the king in the house of God. And Jehoiada said to them, “Behold, the king’s son shall reign, as the Lord has spoken concerning the sons of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the thing which you shall do: one third of you, of the priests and Levites who come in on the sabbath, shall be gatekeepers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one third shall be at the king’s house, and a third at the Gate of the Foundation; and all the people shall be in the courts of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But let no one enter the house of the Lord except the priests and the ministering Levites; they may enter, for they are holy. And let all the people keep the charge of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites will surround the king, each man with his weapons in his hand; and whoever enters the house, let him be killed. Thus be with the king when he comes in and when he goes out.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Levites and all Judah did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded. And each one of them took his men who were to come in on the sabbath, with those who were to go out on the sabbath, for Jehoiada the priest did not dismiss any of the divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoiada the priest gave to the captains of hundreds the spears and the large and small shields which had been King David’s, which were in the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stationed all the people, each man with his weapon in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, by the altar and by the house, around the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought out the king’s son and put the crown on him, and gave him the testimony and made him king. And Jehoiada and his sons anointed him and said, “Long live the king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king, she came into the house of the Lord to the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She looked, and behold, the king was standing by his pillar at the entrance, and the captains and the trumpeters were beside the king. And all the people of the land rejoiced and blew trumpets, the singers with their musical instruments leading the praise. Then Athaliah tore her clothes and said, “Treason! Treason!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiada the priest brought out the captains of hundreds who were appointed over the army and said to them, “Bring her out between the ranks; and whoever follows her, put to death with the sword.” For the priest said, “Let her not be put to death in the house of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they seized her, and when she arrived at the entrance of the Horse Gate of the king’s house, they put her to death there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehoiada made a covenant between himself and all the people and the king, that they would be the Lord’s people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people went to the house of Baal and tore it down, and they broke in pieces his altars and his images, and killed Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Jehoiada placed the offices of the house of the Lord under the authority of the Levitical priests, whom David had assigned over the house of the Lord, to offer the burnt offerings of the Lord, as it is written in the law of Moses—with rejoicing and singing according to the order of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stationed the gatekeepers of the house of the Lord, so that no one would enter who was in any way unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took the captains of hundreds, the nobles, the rulers of the people and all the people of the land, and brought the king down from the house of the Lord, and came through the upper gate to the king’s house. And they placed the king upon the royal throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all of the people of the land rejoiced and the city was quiet. For they had put Athaliah to death with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem; and his mother’s name was Zibiah from Beersheba.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joash did what was right in the sight of the Lord all the days of Jehoiada the priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiada took two wives for him, and he became the father of sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about after this that Joash decided to restore the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He gathered the priests and Levites and said to them, “Go out to the cities of Judah and collect money from all Israel to repair the house of your God annually, and you shall do the matter quickly.” But the Levites did not act quickly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king summoned Jehoiada the chief priest and said to him, “Why have you not required the Levites to bring in from Judah and from Jerusalem the levy fixed by Moses the servant of the Lord on the congregation of Israel for the tent of the testimony?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the sons of the wicked Athaliah had broken into the house of God and even used the holy things of the house of the Lord for the Baals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the king commanded, and they made a chest and set it outside by the gate of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made a proclamation in Judah and Jerusalem to bring to the Lord the levy fixed by Moses the servant of God on Israel in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the officers and all the people rejoiced and brought in their levies and dropped them into the chest until they had finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about whenever the chest was brought in to the king’s officer by the Levites, and when they saw that there was much money, then the king’s scribe and the chief priest’s officer would come, empty the chest, take it, and return it to its place. Thus they did daily and collected much money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king and Jehoiada gave it to those who did the work of the service of the house of the Lord; and they hired masons and carpenters to restore the house of the Lord, and also workers in iron and bronze to repair the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the workmen labored, and the repair work progressed in their hands, and they restored the house of God according to its specifications and strengthened it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had finished, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada; and it was made into utensils for the house of the Lord, utensils for the service and the burnt offering, and pans and utensils of gold and silver. And they offered burnt offerings in the house of the Lord continually all the days of Jehoiada.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Jehoiada reached a ripe old age he died; he was one hundred and thirty years old at his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They buried him in the city of David among the kings, because he had done well in Israel and to God and His house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after the death of Jehoiada the officials of Judah came and bowed down to the king, and the king listened to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They abandoned the house of the Lord, the God of their fathers, and served the Asherim and the idols; so wrath came upon Judah and Jerusalem for this their guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He sent prophets to them to bring them back to the Lord; though they testified against them, they would not listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Spirit of God came on Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest; and he stood above the people and said to them, “Thus God has said, ‘Why do you transgress the commandments of the Lord and do not prosper? Because you have forsaken the Lord, He has also forsaken you.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they conspired against him and at the command of the king they stoned him to death in the court of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Joash the king did not remember the kindness which his father Jehoiada had shown him, but he murdered his son. And as he died he said, “May the Lord see and avenge!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened at the turn of the year that the army of the Arameans came up against him; and they came to Judah and Jerusalem, destroyed all the officials of the people from among the people, and sent all their spoil to the king of Damascus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed the army of the Arameans came with a small number of men; yet the Lord delivered a very great army into their hands, because they had forsaken the Lord, the God of their fathers. Thus they executed judgment on Joash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had departed from him (for they left him very sick), his own servants conspired against him because of the blood of the son of Jehoiada the priest, and murdered him on his bed. So he died, and they buried him in the city of David, but they did not bury him in the tombs of the kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are those who conspired against him: Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonitess, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As to his sons and the many oracles against him and the rebuilding of the house of God, behold, they are written in the treatise of the Book of the Kings. Then Amaziah his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did right in the sight of the Lord, yet not with a whole heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came about as soon as the kingdom was firmly in his grasp, that he killed his servants who had slain his father the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, he did not put their children to death, but did as it is written in the law in the book of Moses, which the Lord commanded, saying, “Fathers shall not be put to death for sons, nor sons be put to death for fathers, but each shall be put to death for his own sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Amaziah assembled Judah and appointed them according to their fathers’ households under commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds throughout Judah and Benjamin; and he took a census of those from twenty years old and upward and found them to be 300,000 choice men, able to go to war and handle spear and shield.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He hired also 100,000 valiant warriors out of Israel for one hundred talents of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a man of God came to him saying, “O king, do not let the army of Israel go with you, for the Lord is not with Israel nor with any of the sons of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do go, do it, be strong for the battle; yet God will bring you down before the enemy, for God has power to help and to bring down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amaziah said to the man of God, “But what shall we do for the hundred talents which I have given to the troops of Israel?” And the man of God answered, “The Lord has much more to give you than this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amaziah dismissed them, the troops which came to him from Ephraim, to go home; so their anger burned against Judah and they returned home in fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Amaziah strengthened himself and led his people forth, and went to the Valley of Salt and struck down 10,000 of the sons of Seir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah also captured 10,000 alive and brought them to the top of the cliff and threw them down from the top of the cliff, so that they were all dashed to pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the troops whom Amaziah sent back from going with him to battle, raided the cities of Judah, from Samaria to Beth-horon, and struck down 3,000 of them and plundered much spoil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after Amaziah came from slaughtering the Edomites, he brought the gods of the sons of Seir, set them up as his gods, bowed down before them and burned incense to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the anger of the Lord burned against Amaziah, and He sent him a prophet who said to him, “Why have you sought the gods of the people who have not delivered their own people from your hand?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was talking with him, the king said to him, “Have we appointed you a royal counselor? Stop! Why should you be struck down?” Then the prophet stopped and said, “I know that God has planned to destroy you, because you have done this and have not listened to my counsel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amaziah king of Judah took counsel and sent to Joash the son of Jehoahaz the son of Jehu, the king of Israel, saying, “Come, let us face each other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joash the king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, “The thorn bush which was in Lebanon sent to the cedar which was in Lebanon, saying, ‘Give your daughter to my son in marriage.’ But there passed by a wild beast that was in Lebanon and trampled the thorn bush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You said, ‘Behold, you have defeated Edom.’ And your heart has become proud in boasting. Now stay at home; for why should you provoke trouble so that you, even you, would fall and Judah with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Amaziah would not listen, for it was from God, that He might deliver them into the hand of Joash because they had sought the gods of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joash king of Israel went up, and he and Amaziah king of Judah faced each other at Beth-shemesh, which belonged to Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah was defeated by Israel, and they fled each to his tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Joash king of Israel captured Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash the son of Jehoahaz, at Beth-shemesh, and brought him to Jerusalem and tore down the wall of Jerusalem from the Gate of Ephraim to the Corner Gate, 400 cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took all the gold and silver and all the utensils which were found in the house of God with Obed-edom, and the treasures of the king’s house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Amaziah, the son of Joash king of Judah, lived fifteen years after the death of Joash, son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, from first to last, behold, are they not written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the time that Amaziah turned away from following the Lord they conspired against him in Jerusalem, and he fled to Lachish; but they sent after him to Lachish and killed him there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought him on horses and buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built Eloth and restored it to Judah after the king slept with his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem; and his mother’s name was Jechiliah of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did right in the sight of the Lord according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He continued to seek God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding through the vision of God; and as long as he sought the Lord, God prospered him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he went out and warred against the Philistines, and broke down the wall of Gath and the wall of Jabneh and the wall of Ashdod; and he built cities in the area of Ashdod and among the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians who lived in Gur-baal, and the Meunites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Ammonites also gave tribute to Uzziah, and his fame extended to the border of Egypt, for he became very strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the Corner Gate and at the Valley Gate and at the corner buttress and fortified them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built towers in the wilderness and hewed many cisterns, for he had much livestock, both in the lowland and in the plain. He also had plowmen and vinedressers in the hill country and the fertile fields, for he loved the soil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Uzziah had an army ready for battle, which entered combat by divisions according to the number of their muster, prepared by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the official, under the direction of Hananiah, one of the king’s officers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The total number of the heads of the households, of valiant warriors, was 2,600.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Under their direction was an elite army of 307,500, who could wage war with great power, to help the king against the enemy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Uzziah prepared for all the army shields, spears, helmets, body armor, bows and sling stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Jerusalem he made engines of war invented by skillful men to be on the towers and on the corners for the purpose of shooting arrows and great stones. Hence his fame spread afar, for he was marvelously helped until he was strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he became strong, his heart was so proud that he acted corruptly, and he was unfaithful to the Lord his God, for he entered the temple of the Lord to burn incense on the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Azariah the priest entered after him and with him eighty priests of the Lord, valiant men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They opposed Uzziah the king and said to him, “It is not for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to the Lord, but for the priests, the sons of Aaron who are consecrated to burn incense. Get out of the sanctuary, for you have been unfaithful and will have no honor from the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Uzziah, with a censer in his hand for burning incense, was enraged; and while he was enraged with the priests, the leprosy broke out on his forehead before the priests in the house of the Lord, beside the altar of incense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah the chief priest and all the priests looked at him, and behold, he was leprous on his forehead; and they hurried him out of there, and he himself also hastened to get out because the Lord had smitten him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King Uzziah was a leper to the day of his death; and he lived in a separate house, being a leper, for he was cut off from the house of the Lord. And Jotham his son was over the king’s house judging the people of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first to last, the prophet Isaiah, the son of Amoz, has written.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Uzziah slept with his fathers, and they buried him with his fathers in the field of the grave which belonged to the kings, for they said, “He is a leper.” And Jotham his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Jerushah the daughter of Zadok.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did right in the sight of the Lord, according to all that his father Uzziah had done; however he did not enter the temple of the Lord. But the people continued acting corruptly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built the upper gate of the house of the Lord, and he built extensively the wall of Ophel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he built cities in the hill country of Judah, and he built fortresses and towers on the wooded hills.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He fought also with the king of the Ammonites and prevailed over them so that the Ammonites gave him during that year one hundred talents of silver, ten thousand kors of wheat and ten thousand of barley. The Ammonites also paid him this amount in the second and in the third year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jotham became mighty because he ordered his ways before the Lord his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, even all his wars and his acts, behold, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel and Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jotham slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David; and Ahaz his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; and he did not do right in the sight of the Lord as David his father had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel; he also made molten images for the Baals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he burned incense in the valley of Ben-hinnom and burned his sons in fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom the Lord had driven out before the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sacrificed and burned incense on the high places, on the hills and under every green tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherefore, the Lord his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Aram; and they defeated him and carried away from him a great number of captives and brought them to Damascus. And he was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who inflicted him with heavy casualties.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Pekah the son of Remaliah slew in Judah 120,000 in one day, all valiant men, because they had forsaken the Lord God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, slew Maaseiah the king’s son and Azrikam the ruler of the house and Elkanah the second to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Israel carried away captive of their brethren 200,000 women, sons and daughters; and they took also a great deal of spoil from them, and brought the spoil to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a prophet of the Lord was there, whose name was Oded; and he went out to meet the army which came to Samaria and said to them, “Behold, because the Lord, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, He has delivered them into your hand, and you have slain them in a rage which has even reached heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now you are proposing to subjugate for yourselves the people of Judah and Jerusalem for male and female slaves. Surely, do you not have transgressions of your own against the Lord your God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, listen to me and return the captives whom you captured from your brothers, for the burning anger of the Lord is against you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the heads of the sons of Ephraim—Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai—arose against those who were coming from the battle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to them, “You must not bring the captives in here, for you are proposing to bring upon us guilt against the Lord adding to our sins and our guilt; for our guilt is great so that His burning anger is against Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the officers and all the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the men who were designated by name arose, took the captives, and they clothed all their naked ones from the spoil; and they gave them clothes and sandals, fed them and gave them drink, anointed them with oil, led all their feeble ones on donkeys, and brought them to Jericho, the city of palm trees, to their brothers; then they returned to Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time King Ahaz sent to the kings of Assyria for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For again the Edomites had come and attacked Judah and carried away captives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the lowland and of the Negev of Judah, and had taken Beth-shemesh, Aijalon, Gederoth, and Soco with its villages, Timnah with its villages, and Gimzo with its villages, and they settled there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Lord humbled Judah because of Ahaz king of Israel, for he had brought about a lack of restraint in Judah and was very unfaithful to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria came against him and afflicted him instead of strengthening him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although Ahaz took a portion out of the house of the Lord and out of the palace of the king and of the princes, and gave it to the king of Assyria, it did not help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the time of his distress this same King Ahaz became yet more unfaithful to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he sacrificed to the gods of Damascus which had defeated him, and said, “Because the gods of the kings of Aram helped them, I will sacrifice to them that they may help me.” But they became the downfall of him and all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, when Ahaz gathered together the utensils of the house of God, he cut the utensils of the house of God in pieces; and he closed the doors of the house of the Lord and made altars for himself in every corner of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In every city of Judah he made high places to burn incense to other gods, and provoked the Lord, the God of his fathers, to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of his acts and all his ways, from first to last, behold, they are written in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city, in Jerusalem, for they did not bring him into the tombs of the kings of Israel; and Hezekiah his son reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hezekiah became king when he was twenty-five years old; and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did right in the sight of the Lord, according to all that his father David had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the first year of his reign, in the first month, he opened the doors of the house of the Lord and repaired them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought in the priests and the Levites and gathered them into the square on the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to them, “Listen to me, O Levites. Consecrate yourselves now, and consecrate the house of the Lord, the God of your fathers, and carry the uncleanness out from the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For our fathers have been unfaithful and have done evil in the sight of the Lord our God, and have forsaken Him and turned their faces away from the dwelling place of the Lord, and have turned their backs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have also shut the doors of the porch and put out the lamps, and have not burned incense or offered burnt offerings in the holy place to the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the wrath of the Lord was against Judah and Jerusalem, and He has made them an object of terror, of horror, and of hissing, as you see with your own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For behold, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with the Lord God of Israel, that His burning anger may turn away from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sons, do not be negligent now, for the Lord has chosen you to stand before Him, to minister to Him, and to be His ministers and burn incense.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levites arose: Mahath, the son of Amasai and Joel the son of Azariah, from the sons of the Kohathites; and from the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi and Azariah the son of Jehallelel; and from the Gershonites, Joah the son of Zimmah and Eden the son of Joah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeiel; and from the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from the sons of Heman, Jehiel and Shimei; and from the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They assembled their brothers, consecrated themselves, and went in to cleanse the house of the Lord, according to the commandment of the king by the words of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priests went in to the inner part of the house of the Lord to cleanse it, and every unclean thing which they found in the temple of the Lord they brought out to the court of the house of the Lord. Then the Levites received it to carry out to the Kidron valley.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they began the consecration on the first day of the first month, and on the eighth day of the month they entered the porch of the Lord. Then they consecrated the house of the Lord in eight days, and finished on the sixteenth day of the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went in to King Hezekiah and said, “We have cleansed the whole house of the Lord, the altar of burnt offering with all of its utensils, and the table of showbread with all of its utensils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, all the utensils which King Ahaz had discarded during his reign in his unfaithfulness, we have prepared and consecrated; and behold, they are before the altar of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King Hezekiah arose early and assembled the princes of the city and went up to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought seven bulls, seven rams, seven lambs and seven male goats for a sin offering for the kingdom, the sanctuary, and Judah. And he ordered the priests, the sons of Aaron, to offer them on the altar of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they slaughtered the bulls, and the priests took the blood and sprinkled it on the altar. They also slaughtered the rams and sprinkled the blood on the altar; they slaughtered the lambs also and sprinkled the blood on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought the male goats of the sin offering before the king and the assembly, and they laid their hands on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The priests slaughtered them and purged the altar with their blood to atone for all Israel, for the king ordered the burnt offering and the sin offering for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then stationed the Levites in the house of the Lord with cymbals, with harps and with lyres, according to the command of David and of Gad the king’s seer, and of Nathan the prophet; for the command was from the Lord through His prophets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites stood with the musical instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah gave the order to offer the burnt offering on the altar. When the burnt offering began, the song to the Lord also began with the trumpets, accompanied by the instruments of David, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the whole assembly worshiped, the singers also sang and the trumpets sounded; all this continued until the burnt offering was finished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the completion of the burnt offerings, the king and all who were present with him bowed down and worshiped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, King Hezekiah and the officials ordered the Levites to sing praises to the Lord with the words of David and Asaph the seer. So they sang praises with joy, and bowed down and worshiped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah said, “Now that you have consecrated yourselves to the Lord, come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings to the house of the Lord.” And the assembly brought sacrifices and thank offerings, and all those who were willing brought burnt offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of the burnt offerings which the assembly brought was 70 bulls, 100 rams, and 200 lambs; all these were for a burnt offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The consecrated things were 600 bulls and 3,000 sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the priests were too few, so that they were unable to skin all the burnt offerings; therefore their brothers the Levites helped them until the work was completed and until the other priests had consecrated themselves. For the Levites were more conscientious to consecrate themselves than the priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were also many burnt offerings with the fat of the peace offerings and with the libations for the burnt offerings. Thus the service of the house of the Lord was established again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah and all the people rejoiced over what God had prepared for the people, because the thing came about suddenly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of the Lord at Jerusalem to celebrate the Passover to the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king and his princes and all the assembly in Jerusalem had decided to celebrate the Passover in the second month,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since they could not celebrate it at that time, because the priests had not consecrated themselves in sufficient numbers, nor had the people been gathered to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the thing was right in the sight of the king and all the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they established a decree to circulate a proclamation throughout all Israel from Beersheba even to Dan, that they should come to celebrate the Passover to the Lord God of Israel at Jerusalem. For they had not celebrated it in great numbers as it was prescribed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The couriers went throughout all Israel and Judah with the letters from the hand of the king and his princes, even according to the command of the king, saying, “O sons of Israel, return to the Lord God of Abraham, Isaac and Israel, that He may return to those of you who escaped and are left from the hand of the kings of Assyria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be like your fathers and your brothers, who were unfaithful to the Lord God of their fathers, so that He made them a horror, as you see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now do not stiffen your neck like your fathers, but yield to the Lord and enter His sanctuary which He has consecrated forever, and serve the Lord your God, that His burning anger may turn away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if you return to the Lord, your brothers and your sons will find compassion before those who led them captive and will return to this land. For the Lord your God is gracious and compassionate, and will not turn His face away from you if you return to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the couriers passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, and as far as Zebulun, but they laughed them to scorn and mocked them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless some men of Asher, Manasseh and Zebulun humbled themselves and came to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hand of God was also on Judah to give them one heart to do what the king and the princes commanded by the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now many people were gathered at Jerusalem to celebrate the Feast of Unleavened Bread in the second month, a very large assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They arose and removed the altars which were in Jerusalem; they also removed all the incense altars and cast them into the brook Kidron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they slaughtered the Passover lambs on the fourteenth of the second month. And the priests and Levites were ashamed of themselves, and consecrated themselves and brought burnt offerings to the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They stood at their stations after their custom, according to the law of Moses the man of God; the priests sprinkled the blood which they received from the hand of the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there were many in the assembly who had not consecrated themselves; therefore, the Levites were over the slaughter of the Passover lambs for everyone who was unclean, in order to consecrate them to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For a multitude of the people, even many from Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not purified themselves, yet they ate the Passover otherwise than prescribed. For Hezekiah prayed for them, saying, “May the good Lord pardon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: everyone who prepares his heart to seek God, the Lord God of his fathers, though not according to the purification rules of the sanctuary.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord heard Hezekiah and healed the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Israel present in Jerusalem celebrated the Feast of Unleavened Bread for seven days with great joy, and the Levites and the priests praised the Lord day after day with loud instruments to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah spoke encouragingly to all the Levites who showed good insight in the things of the Lord. So they ate for the appointed seven days, sacrificing peace offerings and giving thanks to the Lord God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the whole assembly decided to celebrate the feast another seven days, so they celebrated the seven days with joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Hezekiah king of Judah had contributed to the assembly 1,000 bulls and 7,000 sheep, and the princes had contributed to the assembly 1,000 bulls and 10,000 sheep; and a large number of priests consecrated themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the assembly of Judah rejoiced, with the priests and the Levites and all the assembly that came from Israel, both the sojourners who came from the land of Israel and those living in Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was great joy in Jerusalem, because there was nothing like this in Jerusalem since the days of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Levitical priests arose and blessed the people; and their voice was heard and their prayer came to His holy dwelling place, to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all this was finished, all Israel who were present went out to the cities of Judah, broke the pillars in pieces, cut down the Asherim and pulled down the high places and the altars throughout all Judah and Benjamin, as well as in Ephraim and Manasseh, until they had destroyed them all. Then all the sons of Israel returned to their cities, each to his possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Hezekiah appointed the divisions of the priests and the Levites by their divisions, each according to his service, both the priests and the Levites, for burnt offerings and for peace offerings, to minister and to give thanks and to praise in the gates of the camp of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also appointed the king’s portion of his goods for the burnt offerings, namely, for the morning and evening burnt offerings, and the burnt offerings for the sabbaths and for the new moons and for the fixed festivals, as it is written in the law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also he commanded the people who lived in Jerusalem to give the portion due to the priests and the Levites, that they might devote themselves to the law of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as the order spread, the sons of Israel provided in abundance the first fruits of grain, new wine, oil, honey and of all the produce of the field; and they brought in abundantly the tithe of all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Israel and Judah who lived in the cities of Judah also brought in the tithe of oxen and sheep, and the tithe of sacred gifts which were consecrated to the Lord their God, and placed them in heaps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third month they began to make the heaps, and finished them by the seventh month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Hezekiah and the rulers came and saw the heaps, they blessed the Lord and His people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah questioned the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah the chief priest of the house of Zadok said to him, “Since the contributions began to be brought into the house of the Lord, we have had enough to eat with plenty left over, for the Lord has blessed His people, and this great quantity is left over.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hezekiah commanded them to prepare rooms in the house of the Lord, and they prepared them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They faithfully brought in the contributions and the tithes and the consecrated things; and Conaniah the Levite was the officer in charge of them and his brother Shimei was second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehiel, Azaziah, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismachiah, Mahath and Benaiah were overseers under the authority of Conaniah and Shimei his brother by the appointment of King Hezekiah, and Azariah was the chief officer of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kore the son of Imnah the Levite, the keeper of the eastern gate, was over the freewill offerings of God, to apportion the contributions for the Lord and the most holy things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Under his authority were Eden, Miniamin, Jeshua, Shemaiah, Amariah and Shecaniah in the cities of the priests, to distribute faithfully their portions to their brothers by divisions, whether great or small,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: without regard to their genealogical enrollment, to the males from thirty years old and upward—everyone who entered the house of the Lord for his daily obligations—for their work in their duties according to their divisions;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as the priests who were enrolled genealogically according to their fathers’ households, and the Levites from twenty years old and upwards, by their duties and their divisions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The genealogical enrollment included all their little children, their wives, their sons and their daughters, for the whole assembly, for they consecrated themselves faithfully in holiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also for the sons of Aaron the priests who were in the pasture lands of their cities, or in each and every city, there were men who were designated by name to distribute portions to every male among the priests and to everyone genealogically enrolled among the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Hezekiah did throughout all Judah; and he did what was good, right and true before the Lord his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every work which he began in the service of the house of God in law and in commandment, seeking his God, he did with all his heart and prospered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these acts of faithfulness Sennacherib king of Assyria came and invaded Judah and besieged the fortified cities, and thought to break into them for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Hezekiah saw that Sennacherib had come and that he intended to make war on Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he decided with his officers and his warriors to cut off the supply of water from the springs which were outside the city, and they helped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So many people assembled and stopped up all the springs and the stream which flowed through the region, saying, “Why should the kings of Assyria come and find abundant water?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took courage and rebuilt all the wall that had been broken down and erected towers on it, and built another outside wall and strengthened the Millo in the city of David, and made weapons and shields in great number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He appointed military officers over the people and gathered them to him in the square at the city gate, and spoke encouragingly to them, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Be strong and courageous, do not fear or be dismayed because of the king of Assyria nor because of all the horde that is with him; for the one with us is greater than the one with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him is only an arm of flesh, but with us is the Lord our God to help us and to fight our battles.” And the people relied on the words of Hezekiah king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Sennacherib king of Assyria sent his servants to Jerusalem while he was besieging Lachish with all his forces with him, against Hezekiah king of Judah and against all Judah who were at Jerusalem, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says Sennacherib king of Assyria, ‘On what are you trusting that you are remaining in Jerusalem under siege?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Is not Hezekiah misleading you to give yourselves over to die by hunger and by thirst, saying, “The Lord our God will deliver us from the hand of the king of Assyria”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Has not the same Hezekiah taken away His high places and His altars, and said to Judah and Jerusalem, “You shall worship before one altar, and on it you shall burn incense”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not know what I and my fathers have done to all the peoples of the lands? Were the gods of the nations of the lands able at all to deliver their land from my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who was there among all the gods of those nations which my fathers utterly destroyed who could deliver his people out of my hand, that your God should be able to deliver you from my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, do not let Hezekiah deceive you or mislead you like this, and do not believe him, for no god of any nation or kingdom was able to deliver his people from my hand or from the hand of my fathers. How much less will your God deliver you from my hand?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His servants spoke further against the Lord God and against His servant Hezekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also wrote letters to insult the Lord God of Israel, and to speak against Him, saying, “As the gods of the nations of the lands have not delivered their people from my hand, so the God of Hezekiah will not deliver His people from my hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They called this out with a loud voice in the language of Judah to the people of Jerusalem who were on the wall, to frighten and terrify them, so that they might take the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spoke of the God of Jerusalem as of the gods of the peoples of the earth, the work of men’s hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But King Hezekiah and Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, prayed about this and cried out to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord sent an angel who destroyed every mighty warrior, commander and officer in the camp of the king of Assyria. So he returned in shame to his own land. And when he had entered the temple of his god, some of his own children killed him there with the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria and from the hand of all others, and guided them on every side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many were bringing gifts to the Lord at Jerusalem and choice presents to Hezekiah king of Judah, so that he was exalted in the sight of all nations thereafter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days Hezekiah became mortally ill; and he prayed to the Lord, and the Lord spoke to him and gave him a sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Hezekiah gave no return for the benefit he received, because his heart was proud; therefore wrath came on him and on Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Hezekiah humbled the pride of his heart, both he and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that the wrath of the Lord did not come on them in the days of Hezekiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Hezekiah had immense riches and honor; and he made for himself treasuries for silver, gold, precious stones, spices, shields and all kinds of valuable articles,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: storehouses also for the produce of grain, wine and oil, pens for all kinds of cattle and sheepfolds for the flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made cities for himself and acquired flocks and herds in abundance, for God had given him very great wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was Hezekiah who stopped the upper outlet of the waters of Gihon and directed them to the west side of the city of David. And Hezekiah prospered in all that he did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even in the matter of the envoys of the rulers of Babylon, who sent to him to inquire of the wonder that had happened in the land, God left him alone only to test him, that He might know all that was in his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Hezekiah and his deeds of devotion, behold, they are written in the vision of Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, in the Book of the Kings of Judah and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hezekiah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the upper section of the tombs of the sons of David; and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem honored him at his death. And his son Manasseh became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Manasseh was twelve years old when he became king, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did evil in the sight of the Lord according to the abominations of the nations whom the Lord dispossessed before the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he rebuilt the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down; he also erected altars for the Baals and made Asherim, and worshiped all the host of heaven and served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He built altars in the house of the Lord of which the Lord had said, “My name shall be in Jerusalem forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He made his sons pass through the fire in the valley of Ben-hinnom; and he practiced witchcraft, used divination, practiced sorcery and dealt with mediums and spiritists. He did much evil in the sight of the Lord, provoking Him to anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he put the carved image of the idol which he had made in the house of God, of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son, “In this house and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen from all the tribes of Israel, I will put My name forever;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will not again remove the foot of Israel from the land which I have appointed for your fathers, if only they will observe to do all that I have commanded them according to all the law, the statutes and the ordinances given through Moses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Manasseh misled Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to do more evil than the nations whom the Lord destroyed before the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Manasseh and his people, but they paid no attention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the Lord brought the commanders of the army of the king of Assyria against them, and they captured Manasseh with hooks, bound him with bronze chains and took him to Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he was in distress, he entreated the Lord his God and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he prayed to Him, He was moved by his entreaty and heard his supplication, and brought him again to Jerusalem to his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the Lord was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after this he built the outer wall of the city of David on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entrance of the Fish Gate; and he encircled the Ophel with it and made it very high. Then he put army commanders in all the fortified cities of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also removed the foreign gods and the idol from the house of the Lord, as well as all the altars which he had built on the mountain of the house of the Lord and in Jerusalem, and he threw them outside the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set up the altar of the Lord and sacrificed peace offerings and thank offerings on it; and he ordered Judah to serve the Lord God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless the people still sacrificed in the high places, although only to the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh even his prayer to his God, and the words of the seers who spoke to him in the name of the Lord God of Israel, behold, they are among the records of the kings of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His prayer also and how God was entreated by him, and all his sin, his unfaithfulness, and the sites on which he built high places and erected the Asherim and the carved images, before he humbled himself, behold, they are written in the records of the Hozai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Manasseh slept with his fathers, and they buried him in his own house. And Amon his son became king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Amon was twenty-two years old when he became king, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did evil in the sight of the Lord as Manasseh his father had done, and Amon sacrificed to all the carved images which his father Manasseh had made, and he served them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he did not humble himself before the Lord as his father Manasseh had done, but Amon multiplied guilt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally his servants conspired against him and put him to death in his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people of the land killed all the conspirators against King Amon, and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josiah was eight years old when he became king, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did right in the sight of the Lord, and walked in the ways of his father David and did not turn aside to the right or to the left.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in the eighth year of his reign while he was still a youth, he began to seek the God of his father David; and in the twelfth year he began to purge Judah and Jerusalem of the high places, the Asherim, the carved images and the molten images.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They tore down the altars of the Baals in his presence, and the incense altars that were high above them he chopped down; also the Asherim, the carved images and the molten images he broke in pieces and ground to powder and scattered it on the graves of those who had sacrificed to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he burned the bones of the priests on their altars and purged Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the cities of Manasseh, Ephraim, Simeon, even as far as Naphtali, in their surrounding ruins,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he also tore down the altars and beat the Asherim and the carved images into powder, and chopped down all the incense altars throughout the land of Israel. Then he returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah an official of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair the house of the Lord his God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came to Hilkiah the high priest and delivered the money that was brought into the house of God, which the Levites, the doorkeepers, had collected from Manasseh and Ephraim, and from all the remnant of Israel, and from all Judah and Benjamin and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they gave it into the hands of the workmen who had the oversight of the house of the Lord, and the workmen who were working in the house of the Lord used it to restore and repair the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They in turn gave it to the carpenters and to the builders to buy quarried stone and timber for couplings and to make beams for the houses which the kings of Judah had let go to ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men did the work faithfully with foremen over them to supervise: Jahath and Obadiah, the Levites of the sons of Merari, Zechariah and Meshullam of the sons of the Kohathites, and the Levites, all who were skillful with musical instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were also over the burden bearers, and supervised all the workmen from job to job; and some of the Levites were scribes and officials and gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were bringing out the money which had been brought into the house of the Lord, Hilkiah the priest found the book of the law of the Lord given by Moses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah responded and said to Shaphan the scribe, “I have found the book of the law in the house of the Lord.” And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Shaphan brought the book to the king and reported further word to the king, saying, “Everything that was entrusted to your servants they are doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have also emptied out the money which was found in the house of the Lord, and have delivered it into the hands of the supervisors and the workmen.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Shaphan the scribe told the king saying, “Hilkiah the priest gave me a book.” And Shaphan read from it in the presence of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the king heard the words of the law, he tore his clothes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king commanded Hilkiah, Ahikam the son of Shaphan, Abdon the son of Micah, Shaphan the scribe, and Asaiah the king’s servant, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go, inquire of the Lord for me and for those who are left in Israel and in Judah, concerning the words of the book which has been found; for great is the wrath of the Lord which is poured out on us because our fathers have not observed the word of the Lord, to do according to all that is written in this book.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hilkiah and those whom the king had told went to Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tokhath, the son of Hasrah, the keeper of the wardrobe (now she lived in Jerusalem in the Second Quarter); and they spoke to her regarding this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She said to them, “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, ‘Tell the man who sent you to Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord, “Behold, I am bringing evil on this place and on its inhabitants, even all the curses written in the book which they have read in the presence of the king of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they have forsaken Me and have burned incense to other gods, that they might provoke Me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore My wrath will be poured out on this place and it shall not be quenched.”’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the king of Judah who sent you to inquire of the Lord, thus you will say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord God of Israel regarding the words which you have heard,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because your heart was tender and you humbled yourself before God when you heard His words against this place and against its inhabitants, and because you humbled yourself before Me, tore your clothes and wept before Me, I truly have heard you,” declares the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will gather you to your fathers and you shall be gathered to your grave in peace, so your eyes will not see all the evil which I will bring on this place and on its inhabitants.”’” And they brought back word to the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king sent and gathered all the elders of Judah and Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The king went up to the house of the Lord and all the men of Judah, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the priests, the Levites and all the people, from the greatest to the least; and he read in their hearing all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the king stood in his place and made a covenant before the Lord to walk after the Lord, and to keep His commandments and His testimonies and His statutes with all his heart and with all his soul, to perform the words of the covenant written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, he made all who were present in Jerusalem and Benjamin to stand with him. So the inhabitants of Jerusalem did according to the covenant of God, the God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josiah removed all the abominations from all the lands belonging to the sons of Israel, and made all who were present in Israel to serve the Lord their God. Throughout his lifetime they did not turn from following the Lord God of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Josiah celebrated the Passover to the Lord in Jerusalem, and they slaughtered the Passover animals on the fourteenth day of the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set the priests in their offices and encouraged them in the service of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also said to the Levites who taught all Israel and who were holy to the Lord, “Put the holy ark in the house which Solomon the son of David king of Israel built; it will be a burden on your shoulders no longer. Now serve the Lord your God and His people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Prepare yourselves by your fathers’ households in your divisions, according to the writing of David king of Israel and according to the writing of his son Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, stand in the holy place according to the sections of the fathers’ households of your brethren the lay people, and according to the Levites, by division of a father’s household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now slaughter the Passover animals, sanctify yourselves and prepare for your brethren to do according to the word of the Lord by Moses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Josiah contributed to the lay people, to all who were present, flocks of lambs and young goats, all for the Passover offerings, numbering 30,000 plus 3,000 bulls; these were from the king’s possessions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His officers also contributed a freewill offering to the people, the priests and the Levites. Hilkiah and Zechariah and Jehiel, the officials of the house of God, gave to the priests for the Passover offerings 2,600 from the flocks and 300 bulls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Conaniah also, and Shemaiah and Nethanel, his brothers, and Hashabiah and Jeiel and Jozabad, the officers of the Levites, contributed to the Levites for the Passover offerings 5,000 from the flocks and 500 bulls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the service was prepared, and the priests stood at their stations and the Levites by their divisions according to the king’s command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They slaughtered the Passover animals, and while the priests sprinkled the blood received from their hand, the Levites skinned them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they removed the burnt offerings that they might give them to the sections of the fathers’ households of the lay people to present to the Lord, as it is written in the book of Moses. They did this also with the bulls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they roasted the Passover animals on the fire according to the ordinance, and they boiled the holy things in pots, in kettles, in pans, and carried them speedily to all the lay people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterwards they prepared for themselves and for the priests, because the priests, the sons of Aaron, were offering the burnt offerings and the fat until night; therefore the Levites prepared for themselves and for the priests, the sons of Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The singers, the sons of Asaph, were also at their stations according to the command of David, Asaph, Heman, and Jeduthun the king’s seer; and the gatekeepers at each gate did not have to depart from their service, because the Levites their brethren prepared for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all the service of the Lord was prepared on that day to celebrate the Passover, and to offer burnt offerings on the altar of the Lord according to the command of King Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the sons of Israel who were present celebrated the Passover at that time, and the Feast of Unleavened Bread seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There had not been celebrated a Passover like it in Israel since the days of Samuel the prophet; nor had any of the kings of Israel celebrated such a Passover as Josiah did with the priests, the Levites, all Judah and Israel who were present, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eighteenth year of Josiah’s reign this Passover was celebrated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all this, when Josiah had set the temple in order, Neco king of Egypt came up to make war at Carchemish on the Euphrates, and Josiah went out to engage him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Neco sent messengers to him, saying, “What have we to do with each other, O King of Judah? I am not coming against you today but against the house with which I am at war, and God has ordered me to hurry. Stop for your own sake from interfering with God who is with me, so that He will not destroy you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, Josiah would not turn away from him, but disguised himself in order to make war with him; nor did he listen to the words of Neco from the mouth of God, but came to make war on the plain of Megiddo.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The archers shot King Josiah, and the king said to his servants, “Take me away, for I am badly wounded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his servants took him out of the chariot and carried him in the second chariot which he had, and brought him to Jerusalem where he died and was buried in the tombs of his fathers. All Judah and Jerusalem mourned for Josiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jeremiah chanted a lament for Josiah. And all the male and female singers speak about Josiah in their lamentations to this day. And they made them an ordinance in Israel; behold, they are also written in the Lamentations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the rest of the acts of Josiah and his deeds of devotion as written in the law of the Lord,
